title: George walks to a friend's house. He walks 750 meters north then realizes he walked too far. He turns around and walks 250 meters south. The entire walk takes him 13 seconds. What is his speed per second? - Quora

response.answer_text: Essentially you are exploring the difference between speed And velocity. Speed is a scaler number where is velocity is a vector including both direction and rate of travel In this case the speed is total distance traveled divided by time or 1000 m/13 seconds equals 77 m/s (note that since the time is given to only two places the speed is also rounded up from 76.9 to 77 By contrast, velocity equals net displacement per time. A vector going from 0 to the terminal point would be 1000-250 or 750 m in length, divided by 13 seconds equals 58 m/s due North
